data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word خَوْفٌ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
The word أَنْتُمْ comes from the root ا ن ت م and is associated with the meanings: you (plural)

data.meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
data.sentence: The word الْيَوْمَ comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
The word تَحْزَنُونَ comes from the root ح ز ن and is associated with the meanings: To grieve.

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word يَاعِبَادِ comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
